result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick A. Baugh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
*  Pay resitution plus surcharges; the State shall have 60 days to determine restitution.  
*  Restitution hearing will be necessary.  
DOC shall promptly notify the Court, in writing, of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Zach Brost appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Michael Barth.  Victim rights compliance.  Victim present.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 7mos confinement (in the place designated by law) on each count consecutive and consecutive to his present sentence.  Appeal rights.  Deft requests credit for 56 days; no credit at this time.  DA's office to investigate credit issue.  State may pursue action on the restitution issue.  Unpaid court costs shall be rolled into sentence.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Wm. Michel.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Amended misd. information filed.  Deft pleads guilty to both misd. counts; found guilty by the Court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for 18mos each count concurrent.  See conditions.  DNA ordered; written notice given to deft.  Appeal rights.  Restitution to be determined; hrg will be necessary

Appears that the DVR may have purchased the items listed in the complaint for the benefit of the deft.  ADA McNeill needs time to review the documents.  FPT adj to 3/6/17 @ 3pm

Atty Michel requests a short adjournment - just obtained the deft's signature on the DVR official release form to obtain the necessary information to determine whether the equipment was purchased for the use with this deft.  JS removed from the court's calendar.  Another FPT set for 1/23/17 @ 11am.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Atty Jason Sanders appeared on behalf of deft.  Deft not produced from RCI.  Case is not resolved; add'l documentation has not been received.  FPT adj to 1/4/17 @ 10:45am.  Atty Sanders will be w/drawing from the case due to his new employment.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Jason Sanders.  Case is not resolved.  State requests the court allow plea bargaining after since the parties are still exchanging discovery.  JS removed from the Court's calendar.  FPT set for 11/7/16 @ 11:15am, JS 1/23/17 @ 9am.  In addition, defense counsel has accepted a new position in Janesville.  If the case is not resolved on 11/7/16, the transport will be cancelled and another FPT will set for the first week in January.  Atty Sanders will then have to move to w/draw due to his new position.
from deft; copy sent to attys

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Jason Sanders.  Defense requests an adjournment of the FPT/JS dates.  Atty Sanders recently took over the case the first part of August.  In addition, the investigator assigned to the case was recently released from the hospital and needs add'l time to conduct further investigation.  State has no objection.  FPT 10/21/16 @ 10am, JS 11/7/16 @ 9am.
